The guardian ad litem program itself is made up of these wonderful volunteer taught advocates there is a staff of about Seventy people here in Hillsborough County and then about seven hundred of these volunteers and when a child's case comes through um
The court system a judge will assign a volunteer guardian ad litem to their case
That volunteer becomes it's not a mentor and it's not even a parent but it's just they become the voice of that child and they're able to talk to teachers and guidance councilors and and other family members and they're not on the side of the parent they're not on the side of
The parents families and I'm kind of he said she said of what goes on in life
But they're they are to find out what the child what is best for the child and they and they fight for it

As well the guardian ad litem office there is that a team of attorneys that are amazing
And so we were actually we're the only non profit um that funds a guardian ad litem program in the state of Florida to be able to
